{"step_by_step_thinking": "The infant's symptoms of yellow skin and normal feeding and sleeping patterns suggest that he may have physiological jaundice, which is common in newborns and usually resolves on its own without treatment. The mother's report of exclusive breastfeeding is also important, as breastfeeding can sometimes contribute to jaundice in the first week of life. However, breastfeeding should not be discontinued because of jaundice. Instead, frequent feedings can help to eliminate bilirubin, the substance that causes jaundice, from the baby's body.", "answer_choice": "D. Continue normal breast feeding"}
